channel.title: Byte code/java help/idea
channel.description:
Now the title might be confusing, but I have a few questions all regarding java, bots and bytecode. I am competent C++ programmer for over 4 years now. I recently needed Java for a project and have been working with it in-depth.
I understand what bytecode programming is, and how someday it will revolutionize AI development. (programs that can rewrite themselves anyone?) I just don't have a full enough knowledge about runescape client to get started.
Before you ask, I have used the search button.
[ul][li]1. Is it possible to hook functions for standard java functions? Like when a program tries to see if your using silent mouse couldn't you hook a function that returns false? How would I accomplish this if it was possible?[/li] [li]2. Could someone show me, or is there an example/tutorial on how to get runescape setup for BCEL or ASM?[/li] [li]3. If I can preform 1 and 2, then I would also like an example on how to see how much health you have. Tutorial?[/li][/ul]
Here are some posts I read and found helpful but didn't quite understand as I'm not gonna try BCEL or ASM out until I have the runescape client setup properly.
Great BCEL overview: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,160681.0.html
BCEL Hello world: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,16655.0.html
What I intend to do in the end, is make program that loads the client in a window. Figures the location of your character based on bytecode'ing. Hooks that tells the client you aren't using silent clicks. And a TCP frontend for communcation from any TCP enabled programming/scripting language. Scar, C++, Java, PHP etc. etc.
Basically the bytecode will view basic variables. With the radar angle and player position, you could use perspective calculations to find where you need to click. Making a perfect auto-walker. Of course providing random offsets and mistakes and mistake fixers that normal players have.
With a TCP frontend, you could have scripts hosted on websites via a PHP script that runs the clicking and such. The program would have auto-login capabilities, meaning the PHP script wouldn't require information from the user. Meaning safe, but prone to ping time/lag.
contact information to come...
Thanks in advanced! Martinn!

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea

dont fkn lie, you will never ban lawl

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sdouble, post:11, topic:140324”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=192489.msg1733739#msg1733739 date=1188978499]

Also I would suggest joining our IRC channel at /s irc.moparisthebest.com -/j #mopar

There’s plenty of people that can help you, it might just take some effort weeding the information out of them

Except you can’t say half the words in the english language (half the useful words, anyway). Or you’ll get kicked.

Really? Because the only words that were ever on the kick list were ‘fap, epic, fale’ and if those are half the words in your language you don’t need to be on IRC anyway.

@martingon, If you get on IRC we can help you with immediate questions, I can tell you that all you want to do is possible, and that sending undetectable mouse clicks doesn’t even involve any bytecode editing, having a look at Cherokee might help you out, either that or confuse you
[/quote]

Update Cherokee. I’d like to look at it but it’s older than me. =P[/quote]

The first release is, you have to check it out from the SVN, I guess I should have made myself more clear.

[quote=“martingon, post:13, topic:140324”]@Moparisthebest: I joined IRC and was cussed out twice =P

Some guy didn’t like me interrupting his spam-o-lot…[/quote]

/ignore them until I get on and then I will ban them.

Read full topic

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @martingon martingon
item.description:
@martingon wrote:

@Moparisthebest: I joined IRC and was cussed out twice =P

Some guy didn’t like me interrupting his spam-o-lot…
Anyway I’ve got runescape.jar, decompiled some files and I’m still learning BCEL.

I am gonna start a new post. This one served it’s purpose. By the way, my idea is strikingly similar to KYAB… So I’m not sure what I’m gonna do there…

Read full topic

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @martingon martingon
item.description:
@martingon wrote:

If I built the controller, the thing that actually macros, out of Java. Then a C++ controller would actually run faster. TCP over a localhost connection is extremely fast. While web based, like PHP, would suffer from ping time (lag).

Right now I still don’t know anything about setting up a bytecoder with runescape. A link to a tutorial would be nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i dno, you could just open a connection with the slave computer and send the commands to do whatever and control it

sure, it would be nise as a proof of concept, but generally inefficient

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @martingon martingon
item.description:
@martingon wrote:

@XXLegitXX: Hehe, well I’m a respected member of several other forums.

@frank_: socket overhead would be countered by the ability to run scripts from websites, in whatever language you wish and completely safe.

item.title: Byte code/java help/idea
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

scar is shit mate, seriously

i dont know the exact reason that silent clicks are detected, i assume it is because they do not send the proper events or focus on the window

using sockets will just add overhead that is totally unnecessary, if you write a bot, write it in java and use the same VM

Read full topic
